DOC.brief_title: Behavioral Economic Incentives Improve Glycemic Control Among Adolescents Young Adults
DOC.detailed_description: Participants give daily glucose monitoring goal ≥4 glucose check per day ≥1 reading within goal range ( 70-180 mg/dL ) provide iHealth wireless glucometers . Half study participant randomize 3-month intervention arm Way Health . The intervention include daily financial incentive ( $ 60 account begin month $ 2 daily loss non-adherent ) 2-level tiered sponsor network ( youth select 2 people notify non-adherence 2 5 consecutive day ) . The primary outcome HbA1c 3 month compare baseline . Secondary outcome include HbA1c 6 month proportion participant adherent daily glucose monitoring goal . Exit interview elicit intervention feasibility feedback youth perspective .
